author: Eleanor Doughty
title: Five best anti-ageing day creams
text: The anti-ageing market is booming, year on year, and your highstreet shops are fit to burst with every single product you never knew you needed to keep your skin looking healthy. You know by now that using a moisturiser is essential for keeping your skin looking and feeling great all day long . But which one to choose? This is the GoodLife guide to anti-ageing products, and today, we kick off with the day creams. All of these come extremely highly recommended. You can thank us later. 1. Emma Hardie Emma Hardie's Amazing Face Age Support Treatment Cream is an intense hydrating and lifting cream that helps to pump a natural glow into the skin. Antioxidant properties from Edelweiss stem cells help to tighten and lift the skin, while the natural oils of Moringa, Evening Primrose and Rose Hip nourish, moisturise and sooth the skin. £42, emmahardie.com 2. Elemis The ultimate anti-ageing cream, Elemis Pro-Collagen Marine Cream is specifically formulated to nourish and moisturise dry and dehydrated skin. Its powerful anti-ageing ingredients have been shown to improve skin firmness and tone in 15 days, with the unique ingredient Mediterranean algae Padina Pavonica. £80, elemis.com 3. Nude Nude's delicious Advanced Renewal Moisturiser is formulated with peptides, probiotics and omegas to enrich the complexion. Hyaluronic acid plumps fine lines, while algae extract, packed full of vitamins and amino acids, smooths the skin's texture. £72, spacenk.com 4. Lancome Lancôme's Rénergie Multi-Lift makes skin feel tighter and firmer, as wrinkles appear reduced, and contours more defined. Apply using upwards movements to encourage the skin, it's a real treat for the day time. £64, johnlewis.com 5. Dermalogica Dermalogica's AGE Smart™ Super Rich Repair cream is pretty heavyweight, and extremely nourishing. Helping to combat dry and dehydrated skin, its powerful peptides stimulate collagen production while elasticity and tone are improved. £62.85, dermalogica.co.uk telegraph.co.uk Follow @telegoodlife
